reference.title: euca-describe-bundle-tasks
reference.shortdesc: Describes currently submitted bundle tasks and their states.

row.entry: Identifier of the bundle task to describe. If you do not specify a bundle task ID, all bundle tasks are returned.

section.title: Available Filters
section.p: You can add filters to your request so that the response includes information for only certain bundle tasks. For example, you can use a filter to return only the bundle tasks in the complete state. Some tips for using filters with this command:

ul.li: You can use multiple values for a filter. Eucalyptus responds with information for a bundle task only if it matches at least one of the filter values that you specified.

You can use multiple filters. For example, you can specify bundles that are stored in a specific bucket and are in the complete state. Eucalyptus responds with the information for a bundle task only if it matches all the filters that you specified. If there is no match, Eucalyptus returns an empty response.

You can use wildcards in a filter value. Use an asterisk (*) to match zero or more characters. Use a question mark (?) to match exactly one character. To escape special characters, use a backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*eucalyptus\?\\ searches for the literal string *eucalyptus?\.

section.p: The following are the available filters for euca-describe-bundle-tasks:

row.entry: If the task failed, returns the error code
If the task failed, returns the error message
Level of task completion, in percent (for example, 20%)
Bucket where the EMI will be stored
Time of the most recent update for the task

ul.li: Bundle state (pending, waiting-for-shutdown, bundling, storing, cancelling, complete, failed)

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: euca-describe-bundle-tasks BUNDLE bun-CFF03DFA i-E7AC420A mah-bukkit winemi pending 2012-01-01T00:00:00.000Z 2012-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
